channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla is "almost ready" to allow texting when behind the wheel with its Full Self-Driving system
item.description: Musk claims Full Self-Driving will soon allow texting when at the wheel, but fails to explain how that will be legal.

item.title: ‘Tatsuki Fujimoto 17-26’ Is a Joyously Unhinged Look Into the Young Mind of Manga’s Wildest Auteur
item.description: The Prime Video anthology tells eight of the 'Chainsaw Man' creator's earliest short stories, animated by six different studios.

item.title: Android could soon change in a big way thanks to the Google and Epic settlement – here’s what it means for you
item.description: The legal dispute between Google and Epic Games has been settled, with big changes coming to Android.

item.title: Study Finds Around a Quarter of Polymarket Trades Are Fake
item.description: Surely, there's no potential for market manipulation here.

item.title: Ayaneo dévoile sa console-PC qui coutera plus de 1500 euros mais qui cache bien son jeu
item.description: Voici une nouvelle console portable gaming à plus de 1500 € : AYANEO dévoile sa NEXT 2 avec le processeur Ryzen AI Max+ 395.

item.title: Maybe Peloton is its own worst enemy
item.description: For years - through its pandemic-fueled highs and its post-quarantine malaise - Peloton has held its earnings calls at a bright and bushy 8:30AM ET. Not yesterday. Instead, the company broke different news first thing in the morning: it issued yet another recall for 833,000 of its original Bike Plus units, before posting its Q1 […]

item.title: Watch out, these malicious Android apps have been downloaded 42 million times - and could leave you seriously out of pocket
item.description: Threat actors expanded operations using malicious apps, outdated devices, and IoT exploits while global attack volumes surged across key regions.

item.title: WIRED-Approved Brooklinen Bedding Is on Sale for a Few Days
item.description: Upgrade your sleep setup with up to 20 percent off some of our favorite bedding essentials.

item.title: Best Packing Cubes for Every Kind of Trip (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Whether you’re a no-frills backpacker or a bag-checking fashionista, there’s a perfect packing cube out there for you.

item.title: Branch Sale of the Year: Deals on Office Chairs, Standing Desks, and Home Office Gear
item.description: Branch is offering up to 15 percent off sitewide now through December 3.

item.title: $1 Trillion in Tech Stocks Sold Off as Market Grows Skeptical of AI
‘Tis the Season for ‘Addams Family Values’
item.description: Halloween is over, but the winter holidays haven't quite roared to life—here's the perfect movie for these in-between times.

item.title: Rivian gives RJ Scaringe a new pay package worth up to $5B
item.description: The company canceled a similar-sized award from 2021, when EV optimism was sky-high, due to the "unlikeliness" that the associated goals could be met.

item.title: The best Fitbits for your fitness and health
item.description: In 2025, you might wonder if Fitbit is still relevant. Despite being acquired by Google, Fitbit remains one of the most recognizable names in the industry. Fitbit trackers aren’t meant for the most hardcore of athletes, but they’re still excellent devices for tracking overall activity as well as monitoring certain health and wellness metrics, like […]...

item.title: This phenomenal smart lamp is giving serious aurora borealis vibes, and I can’t get enough of it
item.description: Beaming out dynamic color displays as well as practical task lighting, this smart floor lamp has a whole lot to offer.

item.title: Should I look for Black Friday smartphone deals today or wait for what’s coming tomorrow? I’ve previewed the future, here’s what I’d wait for
item.description: I've tested the best smartphones of 2025, and I've seen what's coming in 2026. I can tell you if you should buy now or wait for what's next, depending on your favorite device.

item.title: Seven more families are now suing OpenAI over ChatGPT’s role in suicides, delusions
item.description: In one case, 23-year-old Zane Shamblin had a conversation with ChatGPT that lasted more than four hours.

item.title: Tech’s worst week since April shows the AI boom may be breaking
item.description: With layoffs climbing to a 20-year October high and hedge fund icon Michael Burry shorting Nvidia and Palantir, the hype machine is sputtering. Technology stocks fell on Friday, amid fears of an AI bubble, a further drawn out federal government shutdown, and economic data that suggests consumer sentiment has fallen toward record-low levels.
